data.en: Coping strategy: it is the own conscious effort to deal with losses/shocks to minimize or tolerate the stressed caused by them. The strategies can be either internal (e.g. reduction in household expenditures, selling assets) or external (e.g. borrowing money, receiving help).

data.en:
-Water conservation: protecting natural water resources by placing limits on their use, waste, exploitation and pollution, as well as by reusing them through recovery or other treatment for the purpose of stemming their exhaustion.
-Pits: an excavated hole or cavity in the ground.
-Semi-circular bunds: semi-circular bunds are earth embankments in the shape of a semi-circle with the tips of the bunds on the contour. Semi-circular bunds, of varying dimensions, are used mainly for rangeland rehabilitation or fodder production.
-Stone bunds: contour stone bunds are used to slow down and filter runoff, thereby increasing infiltration and capturing sediment. The water and sediment harvested lead directly to improved crop performance.
-Water retention ditches: retention ditches are large ditches, designed to catch and retain all incoming runoff and hold it until it infiltrated into the ground. They are commonly used for trapping rainwater and for growing crops that have high water requirements
-Contour lines: contour bunds are a simplified form of microcatchments in which the bunds follow the contour, at close spacing, and by provision of small earth ties the system is divided into individual microcatchments.
data.label:

"conservaci√≥n del agua: proteger los recursos h√≠dricos naturales poniendo l√≠mites a su uso, desperdicio, explotaci√≥n y contaminaci√≥n, as√≠ como reutiliz√°ndolos a trav√©s de la recuperaci√≥n u otro tratamiento con el fin de frenar su agotamiento.
-Puntos: un agujero excavado o cavidad en el suelo.
Bandas semicirculares: las casillas semicirculares son terraplenes de tierra en forma de semic√≠rculo con las puntas de los bordes del contorno. Los terraplenes semicirculares, de dimensiones variables, se utilizan principalmente para la rehabilitaci√≥n de pastizales o la producci√≥n de forraje.

- zanjas de retenci√≥n de agua: las zanjas de retenci√≥n son zanjas grandes, dise√±adas para atrapar y retener toda la escorrent√≠a de entrada y mantenerla hasta que se infiltre en el suelo. se usan com√∫nmente para atrapar agua de lluvia y para cultivos que tienen altos requerimientos de agua
-l√≠neas de contorno: los bordones de contorno son una forma simplificada de microcuencas en las que las bordones siguen el contorno, a corta distancia, y mediante la provisi√≥n de peque√±as ataduras de tierra, el sistema se divide en microcuencas individuales "

- Conservation de l'eau: prot√©ger les ressources en eau naturelles en limitant leur utilisation, leur gaspillage, leur exploitation et leur pollution, ainsi qu'en les r√©utilisant par r√©cup√©ration ou par un autre traitement dans le but d'endiguer leur √©puisement.

- Foss√©s de r√©tention d'eau: les foss√©s de r√©tention sont de grands foss√©s, con√ßus pour retenir et retenir tout le ruissellement entrant et le maintenir jusqu'√† ce qu'il s'infiltre dans le sol. data.en:
-Slash and burn: method of clearing and burning forest or secondary vegetation for preparing agricultural and pastoral lands. Term is usually applied in the context of shifting cultivation.
-Fire break: any natural or constructed discontinuity in a fuelbed utilized to segregate, stop, and control the spread of fire or to provide a control line from which to suppress a fire; characterized by complete lack of combustibles down to mineral soil.
-Living fences: a field boundary formed by planting a line of closely spaced trees or shrubs.
-Vegetative strips: strips of land on the contour that left unploughed in order to form permanent, cross-slope barriers of naturally established grasses and herbs. They control soil erosion and prevent loss (through surface runoff) of fertilizers applied to the crop.
-Liming: the application of calcium and magnesium rich materials to soil to neutralise soil acidity and increase activity of soil bacteria.
-Rotational grazing: rotating  the area of land that animals/livestock use to feed (on a seasonal or other regular basis).
-Zero/Minimum tillage: it consists in reducing the breaking and turning over of the soil to the minimum when planting seeds.  This technique helps preserve and/or improve soil quality, by minimizing soil compaction and disturbances to beneficial soil micro-organisms, hence facilitating water infiltration and accumulation of soil organic matter.
-Mulching: it consists in laying a thin layer of vegetal cover on the ground to protect the soil from strong rainfall and excessive infiltration of water, and to enrich it with organic matter.
-Gullies: gullies are formed by an increase in surface run-off  (of watercourses).
-Gully Control/Rehabilitation: gully control is the process minimizing the gullies. Measures consists in (1) improving gully catchments to reduce and regulate the run-off rates; (2) diverting surface water above the gully area; (3) stabilizing gullies by structural measures and accompanying revegetation.
data.label:

"Romper y quemar": m√©todo de talar y quemar bosque o vegetaci√≥n secundaria para preparar tierras agr√≠colas y pastorales. El t√©rmino se aplica generalmente en el contexto de la agricultura migratoria.
- Interrupci√≥n del fuego: cualquier discontinuidad natural o construida en un lecho de combustible utilizado para segregar, detener y controlar la propagaci√≥n del fuego o para proporcionar una l√≠nea de control desde la cual suprimir un incendio; caracterizado por la completa falta de combustibles hasta el suelo mineral.
- Cercas vivas: un l√≠mite de campo formado por la plantaci√≥n de una l√≠nea de √°rboles o arbustos estrechamente espaciados.
- Tiras vegetativas: tiras de tierra en el contorno que se dejaron sin enmazar para formar barreras permanentes de pendiente cruzada de hierbas y hierbas naturales. Controlan la erosi√≥n del suelo y evitan la p√©rdida (a trav√©s de la escorrent√≠a superficial) de los fertilizantes aplicados al cultivo.
-Limitaci√≥n: la aplicaci√≥n de materiales ricos en calcio y magnesio al suelo para neutralizar la acidez del suelo y aumentar la actividad de las bacterias del suelo.
- Pastoreo rotativo: rotando el √°rea de tierra que los animales / ganado utilizan para alimentar (estacionalmente u otra base regular).
- Labranza cero / m√≠nima: consiste en reducir la rotura y volteo del suelo al m√≠nimo al plantar las semillas. Esta t√©cnica ayuda a preservar y / o mejorar la calidad del suelo, minimizando la compactaci√≥n del suelo y las alteraciones de los microorganismos ben√©ficos del suelo, facilitando as√≠ la infiltraci√≥n de agua y la acumulaci√≥n de materia org√°nica en el suelo.
-Mulching: consiste en colocar una fina capa de cobertura vegetal en el suelo para proteger el suelo de fuertes lluvias y una excesiva infiltraci√≥n de agua, y para enriquecerlo con materia org√°nica.
-Galler√≠as: los barrancos se forman por un aumento en la escorrent√≠a superficial (de cursos de agua).
- Control de c√°rcavas es el proceso que minimiza los barrancos. Las medidas consisten en (1) mejorar las cuencas hidrogr√°ficas para reducir y regular las tasas de escorrent√≠a; (2) desviar el agua superficial por encima del √°rea de la barranca; (3) estabilizar barrancos por medidas estructurales y la revegetaci√≥n que lo acompa√±a ".

-Liming: l'application de mat√©riaux riches en calcium et en magn√©sium au sol pour neutraliser l'acidit√© du sol et augmenter l'activit√© des bact√©ries du sol.
- P√¢turage rationnel: rotation de la surface de terre utilis√©e par les animaux / animaux pour l'alimentation (saisonni√®re ou autre).
-Zero / Minimum labour: il consiste √† r√©duire au minimum le broyage et le retournement du sol lors de la plantation des graines. Cette technique aide √† pr√©server et / ou am√©liorer la qualit√© du sol, en minimisant le compactage du sol et les perturbations des micro-organismes b√©n√©fiques du sol, facilitant ainsi l'infiltration de l'eau et l'accumulation de la mati√®re organique du sol.
-Moulage: il consiste √† poser une fine couche de couverture v√©g√©tale sur le sol pour prot√©ger le sol des fortes pluies et des infiltrations excessives d'eau, et l'enrichir en mati√®re organique.

data.en:
-Plant nursery: the act of growing the crop in a controlled environment (e.g. greenhouse) in order to strengthen the plant before it is released in the field (where it would be more easily attacked by pests and stressed by climatic events).
-Transforming the product/processing: it is the practice of transforming/combining raw food ingredients (crop or animal products) into tradable food products with an increased market value.

data.en:
-Pest resistant varieties or seeds: animal breeds or plant seeds that proved to be little or no vulnerable to pest. 
-Plants thinning: the act of removing some of the plants from a crop, or immature trees from a forest, in order to improve the growth of the remainder.
-Nursery treatment: refers to growing the crop in a controlled environment (e.g. greenhouse) in order to strengthen the plant before it is released in the field (where it would be more easily attacked by pests and stressed by climatic events).

-L'√©claircie des plantes: le fait d'enlever une partie des plantes d'une culture, ou des arbres immatures d'une for√™t, afin d'am√©liorer la croissance du reste.

data.en:

-Collaterals: anything of value (e.g. property, stock, bonds, crop, or livestock) acting as an additional security for the repayment of a loan; it is returned to the debtor when the obligation is fulfilled.

data.en:
-Nutrient runoff: when nutrient from commercial/farming/household activities reach freshwaters polluting it.
-Algal blooms: an algal bloom is a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae in freshwater or marine water systems.
-Activated carbon: charcoal which has been treated to remove hydrocarbons and to increase its adsorptive properties. It acts by condensing and holding a gas or solute onto its surface; thus inhibitory substances in nutrient medium may be adsorbed to charcoal included in the medium. Rooting factors such as phenolamines present as contaminants in charcoal may stimulate growth in vitro. Its addition to rooting medium may stimulate root initiation in some plant species. Activated charcoal may differ in origin and in composition.
-Chlorination of water: adding chlorine to an irrigation system to counteract clogging caused by organic materials such as algae and bacterial slime.
data.label:

Activated charcoal may differ in origin and in composition.
-Chlorination of water: adding chlorine to an irrigation system to counteract clogging caused by organic materials such as algae and bacterial slime.

-Activ√© de carbone: charbon de bois qui a √©t√© trait√© pour √©liminer les hydrocarbures et augmenter ses propri√©t√©s d'adsorption. Il agit en condensant et en maintenant un gaz ou un solut√© sur sa surface; ainsi, les substances inhibitrices dans le milieu nutritif peuvent √™tre adsorb√©es sur le charbon inclus dans le milieu. data.en:
-Landscape: landscape includes all the physical elements (both natural and man-made) that can be seen and distinguished in a single view.

data.en:
-Household: within SHARP, a household is considered to include members of the immediate family (e.g. wife, husband, children, sister or brother) and other persons who are sharing the same shelter and share items such as food and resources.
-Household member: a household member is someone who has lived in the household at least six months, and at least three days in each week in those months. Also those persons who are not blood related (such as lodgers or agricultural laborers) are members of the household if they meet these qualifications.
-Crop Production: the actual harvested production from the field or orchard and gardens. Production includes the quantities sold in the market and those consumed or used by the producers (on-farm/household consumption).
-Animal Production: animals raised for the purpose of providing food or income (e.g. fibre, leather) for the members of the household.
data.label:

Also those persons who are not blood related (such as lodgers or agricultural laborers) are members of the household if they meet these qualifications.
-Crop Production: the actual harvested production from the field or orchard and gardens. Production includes the quantities sold in the market and those consumed or used by the producers (on-farm/household consumption).
-Animal Production: animals raised for the purpose of providing food or income (e.g. fibre, leather) for the members of the household.
data.es:
"Hogar": dentro de SHARP, se considera que un hogar incluye a miembros de la familia inmediata (por ejemplo, esposa, esposo, hijos, hermana o hermano) y otras personas que comparten el mismo refugio y comparten art√≠culos como comida y recursos.
Miembro del hogar: un miembro del hogar es alguien que ha vivido en el hogar por lo menos seis meses, y al menos tres d√≠as en cada semana en esos meses. Tambi√©n aquellas personas que no est√°n relacionadas con la sangre (como inquilinos o trabajadores agr√≠colas) son miembros del hogar si cumplen con estas calificaciones.
-Producci√≥n de cultivos: la producci√≥n real cosechada del campo o huerto y jardines. La producci√≥n incluye las cantidades vendidas en el mercado y las consumidas o utilizadas por los productores (consumo en la finca / hogar).
- Producci√≥n animal: animales criados con el fin de proporcionar alimentos o ingresos (por ejemplo, fibra, cuero) para los miembros de la familia ".
data.fr:
-Maison: au sein de SHARP, un m√©nage est consid√©r√© comme incluant les membres de la famille imm√©diate (par exemple la femme, le mari, les enfants, la s≈ìur ou le fr√®re) et d'autres personnes partageant le m√™me abri et partageant des biens et des ressources.
-Membre du foyer: un membre du m√©nage est une personne qui a v√©cu dans le m√©nage au moins six mois, et au moins trois jours par semaine pendant ces mois. De m√™me, les personnes qui ne sont pas li√©es au sang (telles que les locataires ou les ouvriers agricoles) sont membres du m√©nage si elles remplissent ces conditions.
-Crop production: la production r√©colt√©e r√©elle du champ ou du verger et des jardins. La production comprend les quantit√©s vendues sur le march√© et celles consomm√©es ou utilis√©es par les producteurs (consommation √† la ferme / consommation domestique).
-Production animale: animaux √©lev√©s dans le but de fournir de la nourriture ou un revenu (par exemple fibre, cuir) aux membres du m√©nage.

data.en:
-Climate change: it refers to any constant change in climate over an extended period of time (e.g. years, decades) either due to natural variability or as a result of human activity.
-Weather patterns: a weather pattern occurs when the weather stays the same for days or weeks at a time and are often related to seasons (e.g. hot and dry, wet and rainy, cold).
-Coping strategy: is the own conscious effort to deal with losses/shocks to minimize or tolerate the stressed caused by them. The strategies can be either internal (e.g. reduction in household expenditures, selling assets) or external (e.g. borrowing money, receiving help).
